texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: When you dump table data from MySQL, you may end up pulling a large chunk of data and it may exceed the MySQL client's max allowed packet variable. If that happens, you might catch an error like this:
texts.text: When you dump table data from MySQL, you may end up pulling a large chunk of data and it may exceed the MySQL client's max allowed packet variable. If that happens, you might catch an error like this:

texts.label: code
texts.orig: mysqldump: Error 2020: Got packet bigger than 'max_allowed_packet' bytes when dumping table `tablename` at row: 1627
texts.text: mysqldump: Error 2020: Got packet bigger than 'max_allowed_packet' bytes when dumping table `tablename` at row: 1627

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The default max allowed packet size is 25M, and you can adjust it for good within your my.cnf by setting the variable in a section for mysqldump:
texts.text: The default max allowed packet size is 25M, and you can adjust it for good within your my.cnf by setting the variable in a section for mysqldump:
